summary: Solutions-focused, versatile management professional veteran offering a comprehensive background supporting U.S. military operations in roles of increasing responsibility during a 8-year career in the United States Air Force. Effective communicator who quickly masters new roles and technologies to achieve positive results.
skills: Concrete operations (excavation, subgrade, base course, forms, pouring, finishing)

experience.title: General Project Manager - Pavement & Construction Equipment Craftsman
experience.description: Managed various projects and personnel, including removal/replacement of dilapidated asphalt roads and upheaved concrete sidewalk.

experience.title: Airfield Repair Project Lead
experience.description: Led 12 personnel in repairing 267 airfield concrete spalls, securing the Air Traffic Control Movement Area for Minot AFB B-52 bombers.

experience.title: Snow Shift Leader
experience.description: Supervised 15 military and civilian personnel and managed a 16 million dollar equipment fleet in clearing 1.8 million sq ft of airfield pavements, 76 miles of base roadways, and 2.1 million square yards of pavements.

experience.title: Reporting Official
experience.description: Tasked with writing annual performance reports and biannual feedback reports for 3 personnel as well as promoting compliance with all USAF rules and regulations.

experience.title: Antiterrorism/Force Protection (AT/FP) Barrier Plan Program Manager
experience.description: Guided 13 equipment operators in hauling/placing 517 vehicle barriers safeguarding 55 mission critical facilities. Overhauled AT/FP Barrier Plan as construction and new facilities altered the layout of Minot AFB.

experience.title: Lock Out Tag Out Manager
experience.description: Successfully revamped program and trained 53 personnel on proper procedures and regulations.

experience.title: Snow School Instructor
experience.description: Instructed interdepartmental, annual snow school for up to 56 career-augmented personnel. Trained personnel on proper equipment operating techniques, safety protocol and snow removal priorities.

experience.title: Project Leader
experience.description: Led work crews in installing and maintaining all power generation equipment, responsible for $5.2 million in equipment supporting critical facilities for 1 Special Operations Wing, Headquarters AFSOC and 38 tenant units under direct supervision.

experience.title: Shop Logistic Inventory Manager
experience.description: Maintained accountability on over $10,000 of essential parts for mission critical generator power production assets. Conducted weekly inventory count and ordered parts as needed. Secured fund availability by reporting shop stock records to leadership, enabling decisions on parts funding.

experience.title: Quality Assurance Program
experience.description: Managed generator quality assurance program, found and corrected over 25 discrepancies providing oversight for over $650 thousand dollars worth of assets.

experience.title: CPR/AED Instructor
experience.description: Conducted monthly American Heart Association CPR/AED classes preparing over 300 personnel for contingency.

experience.title: CES Booster Club Member
experience.description: Organized booster club and volunteered in executing various fundraisers culminating in over 10 thousand dollars for the support of squadron morale events.

experience.title: Power Production Journeyman
experience.description: Deployed to Special Operations Central Command at Macdill AFB, FL (Forward deployed to Amman Jordan). Repaired three generators saving the Special Forces unit $125,000 and preparing the generators for rapid deployment. Relentless work ethic enabled the engineering team to complete over 300 work orders on compound facilities valued at 15.2 million dollars. Awarded Joint Commendation Medal: Facilitated troop movements for 58 high value personnel and installed two generators for the Multi-National exercise Early Victor. Directly contributed to the successful training of Special Forces leadership and teams from three different countries.

experience.title: Power Production Journeyman
experience.description: Installs, operates and maintains generators; provides comprehensive customer training of emergency generator operations and automatic transfer panels (ATP). Performs preventive maintenance inspections on ATPs, aircraft arresting systems (AAS) and Barrier Arresting Kits. Member of Prime Base Engineer Emergency Force team and AEF Enabler; worldwide deployable.

experience.title: Electrical Power Production Apprentice
experience.description: Maintained 277 generators with automatic transfer panels and seven Aircraft Arresting Systems valued at $16 million dollars; contributed to construction and installation of two permanent BAK-12 systems valued at $2 million while eliminating $36 thousand dollars contractor costs.

experience.title: Electrical Power Production Apprentice
experience.description: Installs, operates and maintains generators; provides customer training on emergency generator operations and ATPs; performs preventive maintenance inspections.

experience.title: Basic Military Training / Electrical Power Production Technical Training
experience.description: Developed basic knowledge of installing, operating, and modifying electrical generators, power production plants and equipment, and aircraft arresting systems.

education.degree: Associate of Applied Science: Construction Technology
education.school: Community College of the Air Force

education.degree: Civil Engineering Silver Flag Training Program
Pavement & Construction Equipment Career Development Course
Associate of Applied Science: Electrical and Mechanical Technology
education.school: Community College of the Air Force

education.degree: Troubleshooting Electrical Power Generation Equipment Course
Contingency Power Generation and Force Bedown Course
Electrical Power Production Career Development Course
